summary: Burning waste outside emits toxins into the air that can be harmful. The military burned waste in Vietnam. Many worry that the toxins released have led to long-term health problems. The Department of Veterans Affairs hasn’t researched whether there is a link between Vietnam veterans’ health issues and exposure. VA’s reviews of available data haven’t indicated that exposure was a major contributor. VA said additional...
title: Veterans Health: Information About Veterans’ Exposure to Open-Air Burning in Vietnam
